instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01521 not drawing 20v
threads.message:
Found short on pp3v3_G3H. Cleared the shot , still 5v no current. 
pp3v3_G3H is present
PP3v3_G3H_RTC is present 
PP1v8_UPC_XA_LDOA is present 
PP3v3_UPC_XA_LDO is present 
PP20v_USBC_XA_VBUS is 5v
No PPBUS_G3H
Pls help

threads.title: 820-01521 not drawing 20v
threads.message:
"PP3v3_G3H_RTC is present
--------------------
No PPBUS_G3H"
Are you really sure?
3V3_G3H_RTC power supply is powered from PPBUS_G3H, trough R5430.

threads.title: 820-01521 not drawing 20v
threads.message:
Sorry my bad. Bad multimeter 
PPBUS_G3H present 
PP3v3_G3H -1.1v very low🥸

threads.title: 820-01521 not drawing 20v
threads.message:
"PP3v3_G3H -1.1v"
Is that L7690?

threads.title: 820-01521 not drawing 20v
threads.message:
Check first diode mode to ground there; compare with good board.

Post U7650 basic voltages; pins 23, 22, 12, 13, 29, 21.

threads.title: 820-01521 not drawing 20v
threads.message:
Resistance 405
Pin 23 -12.31v
Pin 22-3.3v
Pin 12- 0.00v
Pin13-0.00
Pin29-0.00v
Pin 21-0.00

threads.title: 820-01521 not drawing 20v
threads.message:
Really strange to get any voltage at L7690, with 0V at pin 21.

Is the machine recognized in DFU mode?

threads.title: 820-01521 not drawing 20v
threads.message: Can u7000 be the problem, because I met some flux around it, probably the technical reflowed it before it got to me.

threads.title: 820-01521 not drawing 20v
threads.message: U7000 should be good, if you get PPBUS_G3H.

threads.title: 820-01521 not drawing 20v
threads.message: It’s not entering dfu

threads.title: 820-01521 not drawing 20v
threads.message: Check if all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages are present; the small coils around U7800.

threads.title: 820-01521 not drawing 20v
threads.message: No voltages on any coil around pm u7800

threads.title: 820-01521 not drawing 20v
threads.message:
Check for short on these coils.

Do you get correct 3V3_G3H_RTC for sure?
If yes, check LDO voltages from page 64.

threads.title: 820-01521 not drawing 20v
threads.message:
3v3_G3H_RTC is present
LDO_CORE- 1.5v
PMU_LDO3_OUT- 1.7v
LDO_RTC-1.49v

threads.title: 820-01521 not drawing 20v
threads.message:
Compare U7800 LDOs with good board.
Try changing U7800.

threads.title: 820-01521 not drawing 20v
threads.message:
I replaced u7800.
It’s drawing 20v now. But it’s not coming up
The current on the amp meter goes back to zero.
Working around
I found out the some of the coils around the pmic voltages are fluctuating
Like
PVDDCPUAWAKE_SW1/SW2/SW3
The voltage on most of the coils are fluctuating
                      Thermal camera
T2 is getting warm
Then there is a Pulse on u7800 after 2sec.

threads.title: 820-01521 not drawing 20v
threads.message:
Need to get stable PPBUS_G3H and 3V3_G3H_RTC first.
Is that your case?

threads.title: 820-01521 not drawing 20v
threads.message: PPBUS_G3H and 3V3_G3H_RTC are stable. Is the voltages around u7800 are going up and down.

threads.title: 820-01521 not drawing 20v
threads.message:
Compare diode mode to ground readings on U7800 coils with good board.
Do the same for all big coils too.

Reflow U7800, in case didn't solder properly.

threads.title: 820-01521 not drawing 20v
threads.message:
known good board
PVCCPCOREPRIM_SW1/SW1=0.507
P1VPRIM_SW1/0=0.491

PVCCPCOREPRIM_SW1/SW1=0.204
P1VPRIM_SW1=0.230
P1VPRIM_SW0=230

threads.title: 820-01521 not drawing 20v
threads.message: You may have a problem with T2, or U7800.
